TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DetailsViewRowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DetailsViewRowCollection class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. Each row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control uses the DetailsViewRowCollection class for its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> property contains only the data rows. To access the header row, footer row, top pager row, and bottom pager row, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.HeaderRow%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.FooterRow%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.TopPagerRow%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.BottomPagerRow%2A> properties, respectively.
The DetailsViewRowCollection class supports several ways to access the items in the collection:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object from the collection at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an array, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to iterate through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The value of each row is then displayed on the page.
[!code-vb[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_27_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_27_1.aspx)]

Docs.param: An that contains the objects with which to initialize the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class using the specified <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object. The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects with which to populate the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based <xref:System.Array> that receives the copied items from the .
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array> to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this object to the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object into the specified array, starting at the specified index. The array can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based array for the `array` parameter.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the CopyTo method to copy the items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object to an array. The array is then iterated through and the value of each row is displayed on the page.
[!code-cs[DetailsViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/a5b63f53-4f67-4339-95dc-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DetailsViewRowCollectionCopyTo#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/a5b63f53-4f67-4339-95dc-_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the object.
Docs.value: The number of items in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Count property to determine the number of items in the collection. The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine its upper bound. The Count property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Count property to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object contains any items before iterating through the collection.
[!code-vb[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_651_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DetailsViewRowCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_651_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator that contains all objects in the object.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>-implemented object that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object. To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property. Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method to move to the next item in the collection. To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property is undefined.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the GetEnumerator method to retrieve an enumerator that contains the items from the collection. The enumerator is then iterated through and the value of each row is displayed on the page.
[!code-vb[DetailsViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_175_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DetailsViewRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_175_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the rows in the object can be modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the IsReadOnly property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object can be modified.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false`, to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object can be modified in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the object is synchronized (thread safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the IsSynchronized property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object is thread safe.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object is not thread safe.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

Docs.param: The index of the to retrieve from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the object from the collection at the specified index.
Docs.value: The at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object from the collection at a specific index.
[!code-cs[DetailsViewRowCollectionIndexer#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_694_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DetailsViewRowCollectionIndexer#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_694_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the SyncRoot property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection. The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object itself.
For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based <xref:System.Array> that receives the copied items from the .
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array> to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this object to the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This implementation of the ICollection.CopyTo method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object into the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index. The <xref:System.Array> object can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array> object for the `array` parameter.
